rComments: My fav teacher of all time. I miss being in his class so much! he lights up a room full of 500students and keeps you engaged throughout the lecture. Very approachable and open. He responds to emails and helps you understand any concept as long as you reach out. But I'm sad that the course doesn't count towards my degree, that should change!

Simon is a great professor who is passionate about what he teaches as well as his students. A great course that made me look at the world differently. Do the readings, they are fascinating and they are what the exams are built off of.

Seems to be more of an entertainer than a lecturer, though this seems to appeal to the students. Passionate about what he teaches, but doesn't always practice what he preaches. This course does us a theological lens, which wasn't mentioned in course descriptions. Not the greatest in terms of clarifying expectations on assessments.

Appolloni is honestly one of my favourite teachers I've ever had. You can tell he's really passionate about the things he's teaching and wants his students to do well. His lecture was the only one I looked forward to because they were always so fun. He sang us a song and played the hand piano last class. A true pure man.

The class is pretty straight forward. As long as you keep up with the readings, you will be fine. Although the lectures aren't really necessary to attend to pass the class, it for sure helps since Simon is super passionate and explains concepts really well. Fun class overall about an important and interesting topic.
teacherRatingTags: ['Inspirational', 'Get ready to read', 'Graded by few things']

rComments: Simon is a funny guy but his lectures are pretty useless. the course was so reading based that you dont even need to go to class

Amazing prof, very enthusiastic and really cares about the environment. The tests aren't hard as long as you read and take notes. The people crying about the readings are probably lazy because the max number of pages of reading a week was about 40 pages, which is nothing.

Really loved taking ENV100 with Simon!! He made lectures something that I wanted to attend. I definitely regret not attending his office hours, because he seemed like he really cared about his students and kept us in his best interest. At the beginning of his lectures, he would always walk up and down the aisles and talk to us. He's a gem for sure.

Not that many readings if you're in humanities like me, but for people in eng/life sci it might be a lot (30-60 pages/week). Lectures are kinda slow but he's a super nice prof. You have to do the readings if you wanna do well on the exams and you have to go to lectures if you wanna understand the very sparse slides. No tutorials tho & light work.
teacherRatingTags: ['Get ready to read', "Skip class? You won't pass.", 'Test heavy']

rComments: lots of reading, oh come on. it is just a 100-level course, are we expected to write an essay during a test like a professional writer. won't take again, the TAs are hard grader!
teacherRatingTags: ['Test heavy', 'Get ready to read', "Skip class? You won't pass."]

rComments: Simon is a very engaging lecturer; there was never a dull moment in class. While this was a slightly depressing class (we are literally destroying the earth), it was always enjoyable to attend. ENV100 is not a difficult course if you do the light readings and study a little before exams (which combined make up 95% of your mark). TAs are not helpful

The course itself was not what me and my friends thought it was - it is not like IB ESS. He looks into religion etc and it was very hard to understand (not very focused on the env). His tests also asked about which author said a specific quote or which movie a quote came from, not sure why he does that. Prof is caring to students though.
Straight-forward course if you do all the readings.

You can tell that he wants to see all of his students do well in this course. Readings can get a little boring, but you learn a lot about the environment from them. This course also helped me realise my ecological footprint. He is a good professor and his lectures are funny too. Cutest old man.

Look no further. If you are looking for a Professor who is an easy marker and cares about their students this is a class you should take. He was SUPER approachable and non-intimidating. His exam was easy and he has a good sense of humour.

Definitely the best prof I have ever had, very passionate and engaged!! ENV100 is not a bird course, (readings and 3 hour exam) it will be even harder if you are not interested on topics related with the environment. The course was very interesting though, I reccomend!
Lectures are funny and keep you engaged (assuming you were somewhat interested in the course to begin with). Also just a really nice guy.

Great professor who explains things well and inspires to do more for the environment by thinking differently. But it is not a bird course, the marking is tough and definitely have to work hard for any grade. Long 3hr exam (my 3rd year history exam was shorter).

after 6 weeks of attending the lectures of Professor Simon, i realized that we are disconnected from the nature from real world. Moreover, there were so many things that we did not know about what was exactly happening to the Earth nowadays. The way of teaching and readings are wonderful. I would like to take his courses again.

He loves students and always tries to make class as interesting as possible. He's a really good guy! The workload wasn't much and its definitely a course that you can do well in if you put in the effort.

Simon Appolloni aka Chef Simon aka Corporal Earth!!! This guy literally dressed up as chef & a superhero. Really nice guy, approachable, honest & fair. Would definitely recommend this course to others!
Great guy, great class. I learned a lot and I would definitely take it again.

Amazing prof, had him at Brock University and he was always fair and consistent. He gave us extra time for assignments and even let us have a say in what the course outline would be like. Made everyone laugh and was highly engaging. Lectures were never boring and his tests were fair, if you show up to class you will be fine. Easy marker on essays.

Always starts off class with a joke and is very engaging with the students. His lectures are straight forward and he posts them for students who do not come. Very fun guy and his lectures are never boring! Love this prof.
Awesome prof. Tests are easy as long as you do readings and the assignments are enjoyable. Very engaging when lecturing and his classes are always interesting
